issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=app.extra.android

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

||cdn.branch.io^

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.youtube.com/?bp=wgUCEAE%3D](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F%3Fbp%3DwgUCEAE%253D) ### Comment > After using Adguard For Windows for the first time, things were going good until several versions ago after an update, after that, I started having YouTube ads get through sometimes randomly about every day, and I was not the only one. > > Eventually, I reported it through the Adguard support page, Adguard Forums, and through the support option in Adguard For Windows, and I went back & forth with support trying to troubleshoot the issue. > > I tried uninstalling & reinstalling, updating, changing DNS between Adguard & Quad9, with & without security web browser extensions, et cetera, and the longest it worked without happening is maybe two or three days. > > Support had me send logs and advanced logs when ever this would happen, eventually I was told that it was a filter issue with Adguard, and that I would have to report it myself here; for some reason they could not send all the information I had already submitted themselves. > > I decided to uninstall Adguard & use Ublock Origin for a little while, I had no issues with that, eventually I decided to try Adguard For Windows again to see if the issue was still there, unfortunately it is. > > So I am finally reported it here like I already did through all other Aguard support methods. > > Adguard support did not tell me which filter(s) were the problem, I think I asked, but they did not answer; so you will have to ask them for those details, unfortunately I do not know the ticket number, I just know that my emails with that Adguard support has the subject AdGuard for Windows v7.11 – Bug report from last year. > > - Thank you ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/2XZLcqa.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/818cSd3.jpg)

comment.body:
All filters actually.

Here are the troubleshooting steps I have undertaken.

1. Disabled each filter one by one and retry (also disabling/enabling AdGuard after each rule being disabled)
2. Disabled stealth mode in its entirety
3. Disabled DNS protection
4. Disabled Extension

All resulted in the same error where resources in an Azure Resource Group will not show and result in the error that I have attached.

5. I have removed edge from filtered applications - **That's when it worked as it should**.

So, the workaround is to either remove Edge from the filtered applications, or entirely disable AdGuard.

comment.body:
Not reproduced it with AdGuard filters.
You can also turn off these filters, they are included in AdGuard Annoyances.
```
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups,
AdGuard Mobile App Banners,
AdGuard Other Annoyances,
AdGuard Widgets,
```
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

К сожалению, данная проблема не удовлетворяет нашей [политике составления фильтров](https://kb.adguard.com/general/adguard-filter-policy).
У сайта слишком низкая посещаемость.

Для пользовательских правил
```
itnews.com.ua##div[style^="height: 360px;"][style*="margin-top: 10px;"]
itnews.com.ua##div[style^="height: 94px;"]
```

The reporter's comment (Translated by Google Translator):
> Open the browser and open the AdGuard plug-in. When entering the website for the first time, the screenshot of the advertisement is not blocked. It can be blocked after manual identification. Even if you log out of the website and enter again, the blocking is still effective. However, the problem reappears when you re-enter the website after a period of time after closing the browser.

comment.body:
It seems that it's caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`, so please add this rule:
```adblock
whatson.ae#@#.scrollTop:not(html):not(body)
```
to user rules.

@yourduskquibbles Could you please take a look?

comment.body:
maybe works:

```adb
consent.youtube.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', 'form[action*="consent."] [aria-label][jsname]', '', '1500')
```

If scriptlet library was updated in 4.4.5 (21 december 2022).

However, I do not guarantee that the button continues to be unique in the form (then clicker may need check more attribs or use own method similar to `has-text`).

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139741

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

this site often randomly changes the class and id of their ad elements so I'm going to make a pull request that includes the ad filters that are already appearing

2. Screenshots

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

comment.body:
Не повторяется с вашими настройками.
Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение ~60 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

Также включите русский фильтр, он не только для российских сайтов.

comment.body:
@AdamWr could you please take a look? It seems `MutationObserver` does not work with this rule:
`consent.youtube.com#%#AG_onLoad(function(){if(window.location.href.includes("consent.youtube.com")){var a=new MutationObserver(function(){var b=document.querySelector('form[action="https://consent.youtube.com/s"]')||document.querySelector('form[action="https://consent.youtube.com/save"]');b&&(a.disconnect(),b.submit())});a.observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0});setTimeout(function(){a.disconnect()},1E4)}});`

this part(removed `a.disconnect(),`) works from console
`var b = document.querySelector('form[action="https://consent.youtube.com/s"]') || document.querySelector('form[action="https://consent.youtube.com/save"]');b&&(b.submit())`
that filter looks dangerous. Recently they have an id called `ad_poster` which contains some announcements about the change

comment.body:
> This is caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`
> 
> @yourduskquibbles Please take a look.
> 
> Temporary fix for user filter: `msn.com#@$##header { position: relative !important; left: unset !important; transform: translateX(0) !important; }`

This fixed the issue.

- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;

- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;

- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;

- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139741

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

comment.body:
This is caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`

@yourduskquibbles Please take a look.

Temporary fix for user filter:
`msn.com#@$##header { position: relative !important; left: unset !important; transform: translateX(0) !important; }`
